page.title: 06A DAY IN SUTTON ST JAMES
page.content: On a Monday my dad gets up early because he has to go to work in Wisbech.He is the manager of a nursery for the handicapped, and at work he shows and tells people how to set plants in the polytunnels and glasshouses. I get up at eight, and prepare for school. At ten to nine, Barry and I get in the car, and we collect some other children on the way.Mum by this time will be in the greenhouse seeing to the flowers. We take a packed lunch to school. After tea I have to get ready for Cubs, where we play lots of games. When I return, my brother goes to bed, and I tell Mum about my day. I help her a little with the plants. My mum calls my brother a tell-tale because he is always telling them.
